Incident.Summary: VICTIM REPORTED HER SON MAKING UNAUTHORIZED TRANSACTIONS FROM HER BANK ACCOUNT.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
SCENE PROCESSING:

    The complainant provided banking documents detailing the unauthorized transactions. This documentation is located in "Attachments."

    The complainant also brought in a Ziploc baggie containing items she claims belong to her son (the suspect). The baggie contained a burnt spoon with what appeared to be a filter on it, a small empty plastic baggie, a capped needle, and an uncapped needle. These items were collected for destruction/disposal. However, on closer examination, they did not appear to actually contain CDS/CDS residue. Disposal of said items was recorded on body-worn camera. 

    I, Trooper First Class Scott (#7217) of the Maryland State Police, am equipped with a body-worn camera, which was recording during contact with the complainant. 

    AMOUNT REPORTED STOLEN (AS OF INITIAL REPORT): $785.00

SUSPECT:

    NAME: JEFFREY ALLEN JONES (W/M)
    DATE OF BIRTH: JUNE 29, 1973
    STREET ADDRESS: 36 PORTER ROAD, NORTH EAST, MARYLAND 21901
    TELEPHONE: 443-207-4678

VICTIM:

    NAME: LINDA CAROL REICHENBACH (W/F)
    DATE OF BIRTH: JUNE 13, 1952
    STREET ADDRESS: 36 PORTER ROAD, NORTH EAST, MARYLAND 21901
    TELEPHONE: 443-243-3428
    
NARRATIVE:

    On September 15, 2023, at approximately 1231 hours, I, Trooper First Class Scott (#7217) of the Maryland State Police, made contact with Linda Reichenbach (see "VICTIM") in the Maryland State Police North East Barrack lobby. Linda visited the barrack to report a theft. 

    Linda advised that she happened to check her savings account and noticed withdrawals that she did not recognize. She said she spoke to her daughter and asked if she lent her daughter her card. Her daughter told her she did not. Linda then went to her bank (M&T Bank). The bank provided her with transaction documentation and told her the transactions occurred at the country store located at 2815 North East Road, North East, Maryland 21901. 

    Linda said she never shops at that location. She said she went to the High's she frequents and withdrew cash to see if that location had the same number on her banking documentation. She said the High's did not. 

    Linda said she then made contact with the country store (which is literally listed as "Country Store" on Google) and the store was able to pull camera footage from the times of some of the transactions. Linda said she was able to obtain and view the footage. She displayed an image she said is from the footage she viewed, and she said the male suspect in the footage is her son, Jeffrey Allen Jones (see "SUSPECT"). She said she's positive it's him. 

    Linda said the unauthorized transactions began in June 2023. She said she did not give Jeffrey permission to use her card/make transactions with her account. She believes Jeffrey is using the funds to supply a drug habit. She then displayed a Ziploc plastic bag containing items she said are her sons (see "SCENE PROCESSING"). She said the needles and a small plastic baggie were found in her bathroom, and the spoon contained in the bag was in her son's lock box. On closer examination, the items did not appear to actually contain controlled dangerous substances or residue. However, the spoon did have some burn marks on the back of it. Based on my training, knowledge, and experience as a Maryland State Trooper, I know a common method of drug abuse can involve the burning of controlled dangerous substances on an item such as a spoon to assist with administration. This in mind, I wouldn't be surprised if she is correct about why the unauthorized transactions are occurring. Since these items did not appear to actually contain controlled substances, the needles were placed in the barrack sharps container and the Ziploc bag containing the spoon and plastic baggie was appropriately disposed of. 

    Linda said she wants to press charges against Jeffrey. I offered her the option of applying for charges on her own, but she advised she would prefer I apply for charges against Jeffrey. 

    The bank documentation Linda provided during our initial interaction lists $785.00 fraudulently withdrawn. I recall her saying she may be able to retrieve documentation showing that even more was stolen. 

    I provided Linda with my name/rank/identification number, the case number, my government email, and the North East Barrack non-emergency telephone line. I recommended she apply for a peace order and an eviction notice against her son. 

    I called the country store at approximately 1010 hours on September 16, 2023 from the North East Barrack recorded line. I ultimately spoke to an employee named "Prag." He said a woman named "Therese" is able to access the footage I'm seeking, and that she will be available at 1400 hours. I gave him my government email address and asked him to have relevant footage emailed to me for evidence collection. 

    I request this case remain open pending follow-up. 

    All events occurred in Cecil County, Maryland.

SCENE PROCESSING:

    A chain of custody log was completed for video footage and a signed certification form was obtained. Copies of each can be found in "Attachments." Video footage was burned to disc and submitted to the Maryland State Police North East Barrack Property Room as evidence. 

NARRATIVE:

    On September 16, 2023, at approximately 1426 hours, I, Trooper First Class Scott (#7217) of the Maryland State Police, received video footage from Prag Patel, who I understand is the owner of the Country Store involved in this incident. The video footage was received on my government email. 

    I emailed a blank video certification form to Patel, which was filled out by Theresa Malin, an employee of Patel's who I understand to be the specific employee that retrieved the video footage for Patel to send to me. Patel emailed the completed certification form back to me. 

    Patel noted the following on his email:

        - Malin said the time stamp on the camera footage is about fifty minutes off, but he is certain that the provided videos are of the reported transactions. 
        - Patel and Malin viewed another video that covered another $200.00 theft. However, he said that specific video was lost due to time expiration. 

    Upon viewing the footage, I observed it depicted a white male approach what I understand to be the store's ATM. The male appears to have buzzed gray hair. In the footage dated to July 1, 2023, he is depicted wearing a white "Puma" shirt. The July 1, 2023 footage appears to clearly capture the male withdrawing what seems to be cash. The video dated July 4, 2023 depicts what seems to be the same male wearing a black ball cap and a white t-shirt. The last video depicts what appears to be the same male wearing no ball cap and a white t-shirt on July 17, 2023. The male seems to withdraw cash in the July 4 and July 17 videos as well. 

    I would note the footage I was provided appears to be a recording of the physical television/computer screen playing the footage back. 

    Footage was burned to a disc on October 27, 2023 and submitted to the Maryland State Police North East Barrack Property Room for evidentiary purposes. 

    I request this case remain open pending further investigation/the completion of an application for charges. 

    The above events occurred in Cecil County, Maryland.

NARRATIVE:

    On November 5, 2023, I, Trooper First Class Scott (#7217) of the Maryland State Police, applied for charges against Jeffrey Jones in relation to this case. A copy of the issued arrest warrant can be found in "Attachments." I also included images from surveillance footage in "Attachments" for reference within this report, along with a previous mugshot of Jones from RMS for comparison to the suspect in the footage image(s). 

    Jones has been charged with Theft Scheme: $100 to <$1,500, Credit Card: Steal Another's, and Theft: $100 to Under $1,500 as a result of my application for charges against him. 

    As I noted in my application for charges, it seemed that Jones already had an active bench warrant at the time of my application due to a separate matter (Warrant #: D-032-CR-22-000104-2).

    I request this case remain open pending warrant service. 

    All events occurred in Cecil County, Maryland.
